sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 1
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Performance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a detailed discussion of our executive compensation program, please see the Compensation Discussion and Analysis beginning on page 28.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to be simple, effective, and link pay to performance, while reflecting the size, scope, and success of Apples business, as well as the responsibilities of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The elements of our program and highlights from 2016 are as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual base salary for our CEO was $3 million, and the annual base salary for each of our other named executive officers was $1 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The cash incentive program for our named executive officers measured net sales and operating income results against threshold, target, and maximum performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The equity awards granted to our named executive officers contain a substantial performance component based on Apples total shareholder return relative to the other companies in the S&P 500 over a three-year performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Named Executive Officer Target Pay Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Annual Cash Incentive 6M 3M Base Salary Tim Cook has not received an equity award since 2011 Performance-Based Equity Award Time-Based Equity Award 8M 12M 2M 1M Other Named Executive Officers Annual Cash Incentive Base Salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The chart above shows target dollar values for each element of our named executive officers 2016 compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentives for 2016 paid out at 89.5% of target.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, please see the annual cash incentive discussion beginning on page 33.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 2
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Financial Performance and Annual Cash Incentive Payouts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple delivered another year of strong financial results in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the two financial measures used to evaluate executive performance under our annual cash incentive program, net sales and operating income, declined from our record-breaking 2015 levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results were below the target performance goals set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As aresult,theannualcash incentivepayouts toour namedexecutiveofficers werebelowtarget.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating Incom $60.0B
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Incentives and Total Shareholder Return
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple is focused on creating long-term value for our shareholders, and for the three-year period from September 29, 2013 through September 24, 2016, our total shareholder return was 73.6%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is weighted considerably toward long-term equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice creates a substantial retention incentive, encourages our executive officers to focus on Apples long-term success, and aligns with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Compensation Program Updates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, we increased the performance-based component of our long-term equity incentives to 50% of the grant date fair value of the award, placing an even greater emphasis on performance-based compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 3
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes that effective corporate governance should include regular constructive discussions with our shareholders We have a proactive engagement process that encourages feedback from our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This feedback helps shape our governance practices, which include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority voting standard for uncontested elections of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: One or more holders entitled to cast at least 10% of votes are permitted to call a special meeting of shareholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adoption of proxy access in 2015, and recently adopted enhancements to our proxy access bylaws to make it easier for shareholders to nominate director candidates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes to the performance-based component of the long-term equity incentives under our 2017 executive compensation program; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines for our CEO, executive officers, and directors.

sentences.text: General
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why am I receiving these materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are invited to attend Apples 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders and vote on the proposals described in this Proxy Statement because you were an Apple shareholder on December 30, 2016 (the Record Date).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple is soliciting proxies for use at the Annual Meeting, including any postponements or adjournments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan on attending the Annual Meeting in person, we encourage you to vote your shares in advance using one of the methods described in this Proxy Statement to ensure that your vote will be represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These materials were first sent or made available to shareholders on January 6, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is included in these proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice of 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proxy Statement for the Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended September 24, 2016 (the Annual Report)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you requested printed versions by mail, these printed proxy materials also include the proxy card or voting instruction form for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 6
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a one-page notice in the mail regarding the internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple uses the internet as the primary means of furnishing proxy materials to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice of Internet Availability) to our shareholders with instructions on how to access the proxy materials online or request a printed copy of the materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may follow the instructions in the Notice of Internet Availability to elect to receive future proxy materials in print by mail or electronically by email.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage shareholders to take advantage of the availability of the proxy materials online to help reduce the environmental impact of our annual meetings, and reduce Apples printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples proxy materials are also available at investor.apple.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I share an address with another shareholder, and we received only one paper copy of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I obtain an additional copy of the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has adopted a procedure called householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this procedure, Apple may deliver a single copy of the Notice of Internet Availability and, if you requested printed versions by mail, this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report to multiple shareholders who share the same address, unless Apple has received contrary instructions from one or more of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure reduces the environmental impact of our annual meetings, and reduces Apples printing and mailing costs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who participate in householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon written or oral request, Apple will deliver promptly a separate copy of the Notice of Internet Availability and, if you requested printed versions by mail, this Proxy Statement and the Annual Report to any shareholder that elects not to participate in householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To receive, free of charge, a separate copy of the Notice of Internet Availability and, if you requested printed versions by mail, this Proxy Statement or the Annual Report, or separate copies of any future notice, proxy statement, or annual report, you may write or call Apple at the following email address, physical address, or phone number:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: investor_relations@apple.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Investor Relations 1 Infinite Loop MS: 301-4IR Cupertino, California 95014 (408) 974-3123
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are receiving more than one copy of the proxy materials at a single address and would like to participate in householding, please contact Apple at the email address, physical address, or phone number above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who hold shares in street name may contact their brokerage firm, bank, broker-dealer, or other similar organization to request information about householding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the quorum requirement for the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Holders of a majority of the shares entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting must be present at the Annual Meeting in person or by proxy for the transaction of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is called a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your shares will be counted for purposes of determining if there is a quorum if:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are entitled to vote and you are present in person at the Annual Meeting; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have properly voted by proxy online, by phone or by submitting a proxy card or voting instruction form by mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes and abstentions are counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a quorum is not present, we may propose to adjourn the Annual Meeting to solicit additional proxies and reconvene the Annual Meeting at a later date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A representative from Apples transfer agent, Computershare Trust Company, N.A. (Computershare), will serve as the inspector of election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have agreed to pay Georgeson a fee of approximately $15,000 plus out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may contact Georgeson at (866) 828-4304.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Forwarding printed proxy materials by mail to beneficial owners who specifically request them; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Obtaining beneficial owners voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to solicitations by mail, the proxy solicitor and Apples directors, officers, and employees, without additional compensation, may solicit proxies on Apples behalf in person, by phone, or by electronic communication.

sentences.text: Voting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who may vote at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each share of Apples common stock has one vote on each matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only shareholders of record as of the close of business on the Record Date are entitled to attend and vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, there were 5,257,816,000 shares of Apples common stock issued and outstanding, held by 26,000 shareholders of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to shareholders of record of Apples common stock, beneficial owners of shares held in street name as of the Record Date can vote using the methods described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 8
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the difference between a shareholder of record and a beneficial owner of shares held in street name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Computershare, you are the shareholder of record with respect to those shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owner of Shares Held in Street Name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held in an account at a brokerage firm, bank, broker- dealer, or other similar organization, then you are the beneficial owner of shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a beneficial owner, you have the right to instruct your broker, bank, trustee, or nominee how to vote your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most individual shareholders are beneficial owners of shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I am a shareholder of record, how do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record, there are four ways to vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote in person at the Annual Meeting by requesting a ballot from an usher when you arrive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may vote by proxy by visiting investorvote.com/AAPL and following the instructions provided in th Notice of Internet Availability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you request printed copies of the proxy materials by mail, you will receive a proxy card and you may vote by proxy by calling the toll free number found on the proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you request printed copies of the proxy materials by mail, you will receive a proxy card and you may vote by proxy by filling out the proxy card and returning it in the envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if you plan on attending the Annual Meeting in person, we encourage you to vote your shares in advance online, by phone, or by mail to ensure that your vote will be represented at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If I am a beneficial owner of shares held in street name, how do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name, there are four ways to vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and wish to vote in person at the Annual Meeting, you must obtain a legal proxy from the organization that holds your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A legal proxy is a written document that authorizes you to vote your shares held in street name at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please contact the organization that holds your shares for instructions regarding obtaining a legal proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How are proxies voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares represented by valid proxies received prior to the taking of the vote at the Annual Meeting will be voted and where a shareholder specifies by means of the proxy a choice with respect to any matter to be acted upon, the shares wil be voted in accordance with the shareholders instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Can I change my vote after I have voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy and change your vote at any time before the taking of the vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In Person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy and change your vote by attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your attendance at the Annual Meeting will not automatically revoke your proxy unless you properly vote at the Annual Meeting or specifically request that your prior proxy be revoked by delivering a written notice of revocation prior to the Annual Meeting to Apples Secretary at 1 Infinite Loop, MS: 301-4GC, Cupertino, California 95014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may change your vote using the online voting method described above, in which case only your latest internet proxy submitted prior to the Annual Meeting will be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Phone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may change your vote using the phone voting method described above, in which case only your latest telephone proxy submitted prior to the Annual Meeting will be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy and change your vote by signing and returning a new proxy card or voting instruction form dated as of a later date, in which case only your latest proxy card or voting instruction form received prior to the Annual Meeting will be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What happens if I do not give specific voting instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders of Record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a shareholder of record and you:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Indicate when voting online or by phone that you wish to vote as recommended by the Board; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sign and return a proxy card without giving specific voting instructions,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: then the persons named as proxy holders, Luca Maestri and Bruce Sewell, will vote your shares in the manner recommended by the Board on all matters presented in this Proxy Statement and as they may determine in their best judgment with respect to any other matters properly presented for a vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial Owners of Shares Held in Street Name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner of shares held in street name and do not provide the organization that holds your shares with specific voting instructions, then the organization that holds your shares may generally vote your shares in their discretion on routine matters, but cannot vote on non-routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Which proposals are considered routine or non-routine?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following proposal is considered a routine matter:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ratification of the appointment of Ernst & Young LLP as Apples independent registered public accounting firm for 2017 (Proposal No. 2).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker or other nominee may generally vote in their discretion on routine matters, and therefore no broker non-votes are expected in connection with Proposal No. 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 10
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following proposals are considered non-routine matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of directors (Proposal No. 1);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory resolution to approve executive compensation (Proposal No. 3);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advisory vote on the frequency of advisory votes on executive compensation (Proposal No. 4); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of shareholder proposals No. 5 through No. 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the organization that holds your shares does not receive instructions from you on how to vote your shares on a non- routine matter, that organization will inform the inspector of election that it does not have the authority to vote on the matter with respect to your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is generally referred to as a broker non-vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, broker non-votes may exist in connection with Proposal No. 1 and Proposals No. 3 through No. 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the voting requirement to approve each of the proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the election of directors (Proposal No. 1), Apples bylaws provide that, in an uncontested election of directors, the affirmative vote of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority of the shares required to constitute a quorum is required to elect a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An uncontested election of directors means an election of directors in which the number of candidates for election does not exceed the number of directors to be elected by the shareholders at that election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of Proposal No. 2, Proposal No. 3, and Proposals No. 5 through No. 9 requires, in each case, the affirmative vote of both
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority of the shares required to constitute a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A plurality of the votes cast for Proposal No. 4 will be considered the shareholders preferred frequency for holding an advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How are broker non-votes and abstentions treated?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes and abstentions are counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only FOR and AGAINST votes are counted for purposes of determining the votes received in connection with each proposal (or, in the case of Proposal No. 4, votes for 1 Year, 2 Years, and 3 Years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes and abstentions will have no effect on determining whether the affirmative vote constitutes a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting (or, in the case of Proposal No. 4, whether the vote for 1 Year, 2 Years, or 3 Years constitutes a plurality of the shares voted on the proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, for each proposal other than Proposal No. 4, the affirmative vote equal to a majority of the shares necessary to constitute a quorum is also required for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, broker non-votes and abstentions could prevent the election of a director or the approval of a proposal because they do not count as affirmative votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Is my vote confidential?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy instructions, ballots, and voting tabulations that identify individual shareholders are handled in a manner that protects your voting privacy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple will not disclose the proxy instructions or ballots of individual shareholders, except:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow for the tabulation and certification of votes;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To facilitate a successful proxy solicitation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assert claims for Apple;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To defend claims against Apple; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As necessary to meet applicable legal requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors, Corporate Governance, and Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Board consists of a diverse group of leaders in their respective fields.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most of our directors have senior leadership experience at major domestic and multinational companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these positions, they have gained significant and diverse management experience, including strategic and financial planning, public company financial reporting, compliance, risk management and leadership development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They also have experience serving as executive officers, or on boards of directors and board committees, of other public companies, and have an understanding of corporate governance practices and trends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, many of our directors have experience as directors or trustees of significant academic, research, nonprofit, and philanthropic institutions, and bring unique perspectives to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (the Nominating Committee) believe the skills, qualities, attributes, and experience of our directors provide Apple with business acumen and a diverse range of perspectives to engage each other and management to address effectively Apples evolving needs and represent the best interests of Apples shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee considers candidates for director who are recommended by its members, by other Board members, by shareholders, and by management, as well as those identified by a third-party search firm retained to assist in identifying and evaluating possible candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating potential nominees to the Board, the Nominating Committee considers, among other things, independence, character, ability to exercise sound judgment, diversity, age, demonstrated leadership, skills, including financial literacy, and experience in the context of the needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee is committed to actively seeking out highly qualified women and individuals from minority groups to include in the pool from which Board nominees are chosen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee considers candidates recommended by shareholders and evaluates them using the same criteria as for other candidates recommended by its members, other members of the Board, or other persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2015, the Board adopted amendments to our bylaws to implement proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A shareholder, or group of up to 20 shareholders, owning continuously for at least three years shares of Apple stock representing an aggregate of at least 3% of our outstanding shares, may nominate and include in Apples proxy materials director nominees constituting up to 20% of Apples Board, provided that the shareholder(s) and nominee(s) satisfy the requirements in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, the Board adopted additional amendments to our bylaws to enhance our proxy access framework and make it easier for shareholders to nominate proxy access candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple no longer requires shareholders who nominate a proxy access candidate to recall loaned shares and hold them through the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership of loaned shares is deemed to continue if the shareholder(s) has the power to recall the loaned shares on five business days notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple increased the availability of proxy access by limiting the circumstances under which the maximum number of proxy access candidates is reduced.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Apple no longer reduces the number of proxy access candidates when an incumbent director was nominated through proxy access in the last two years and is subsequently supported by the Board for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may now re-nominate a proxy access candidate regardless of the level of support received at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has extended the deadline by which nominating shareholders and proxy access candidates must provide certain information to Apple to ten business days from five business days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 13
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has narrowed the scope of a nominating shareholders indemnification obligations to legal and regulatory violations arising out of a nominating shareholders actions or communications with Apple shareholders or out of information provided by a nominating shareholder to Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has limited the discretion of the Board to unilaterally interpret the proxy access provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Board oversees the CEO and other senior management in the competent and ethical operation of Apple on a day- to-day basis and assures that the long-term interests of shareholders are being served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To satisfy the Boards duties, directors are expected to take a proactive, focused approach to their positions, and set standards to ensure that Apple is committed to business success through the maintenance of high standards of responsibility and ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples key governance documents, including our Corporate Governance Guidelines and committee charters, are available at investor.apple.com/corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The governance structure is designed to foster principled actions, informed and effective decision-making, and appropriate monitoring of both compliance and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board met four times during 2016, and each member of the Board attended or participated in 75% or more of the aggregate of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the total number of meetings of the Board held during 2016, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the total number of meetings held by each committee of the Board on which such person served during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes its current leadership structure best serves the objectives of the Boards oversight of management, the Boards ability to carry out its roles and responsibilities on behalf of Apples shareholders, and Apples overall corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes the separation of the Chairman and CEO roles allows the CEO to focus his time and energy on operating and managing Apple and leverages the Chairmans experience and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board periodically reviews the leadership structure to determine whether it continues to best serve Apple and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has a standing Audit and Finance Committee (the Audit Committee), Compensation Committee, and Nominating Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that the Chairs of each committee and all committee members are independent under applicable rules of The NASDAQ Stock Market LLC (NASDAQ), the New York Stock Exchange LLC (NYSE), and the SEC for committee memberships.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee operates under written charters adopted by the Board that are available at investor.apple.com/corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee assists the Board in oversight and monitoring of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples financial statements and other financial information provided by Apple to its shareholders and others;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with legal, regulatory, and public disclosure requirements;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent auditors, including their qualifications and independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples system of internal controls, including the internal audit function;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Treasury and finance matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enterprise risk management, privacy, and data security; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The auditing, accounting, and financial reporting process generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also appoints Apples independent registered public accounting firm and reviews the services performed by the firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met nine times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 19
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews and approves the compensation arrangements for Apples executive officers, including the CEO, administers Apples equity compensation plans, and reviews the Boards compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees authority to grant equity awards may not be delegated to Apples management or others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the Compensation Committees processes and procedures, including the roles of the independent compensation consultant and Apples executive officers in support of the Compensation Committees decision-making process, see the section entitled Compensation Discussion and Analysis below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee met seven times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee assists the Board in identifying qualified individuals to become directors, makes recommendations to the Board concerning the size, structure, and composition of the Board and its committees, monitors the process to assess the Boards effectiveness, and oversees and makes recommendations regarding corporate governance matters, including implementing Apples Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee met four times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating Committee has recommended to the full Board each of the nominees named in this Proxy Statement for election to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that evaluating the executive teams management of the various risks confronting Apple is one of its most important areas of oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In carrying out this critical responsibility, the Board has designated the Audit Committee with primary responsibility for overseeing enterprise risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with this responsibility, the Audit Committee monitors Apples significant business risks, including financial, operational, privacy, data security, business continuity, legal and regulatory, and reputational exposures, and reviews the steps management has taken to monitor and control these exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to privacy and data security, the Audit Committee reviews reports from Apples Vice President of Corporate Information Security, General Counsel, Chief Compliance Officer, and Vice President of Internal Audit, including updates on risk management, Apples privacy program, and relevant legislative, regulatory, and technical developments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is assisted by a Risk Oversight Committee consisting of key members of management, including Apples Chief Financial Officer and General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Risk Oversight Committee reports regularly to the Audit Committee, which reports regularly to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Audit Committee has primary responsibility for overseeing enterprise risk management, the other Board committees also consider risks within their areas of responsibility and apprise the Board of significant risks and managements response to those risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the Nominating Committee reviews legal and regulatory compliance risks as they relate to corporate governance structure and processes, and the Compensation Committee reviews risks related to compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Board and its committees oversee risk management strategy, management is responsible for implementing and supervising day-to-day risk management processes and reporting to the Board and its committees on such matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In establishing and reviewing Apples executive compensation program, the Compensation Committee considers whether the program encourages unnecessary or excessive risk-taking and has concluded that it does not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives base salaries are fixed in amount and thus do not encourage risk-taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentives are capped and payouts are formulaic and tied to specific company financial performance metrics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The majority of compensation provided to the executive officers is in the form of time-based and performance-based equity awards that vest over several years and help further align executives interests with those of Apples shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that these awards do not encourage unnecessary or excessive risk-taking because the ultimate value of the awards is tied to Apples stock price
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 20
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance over several years and because awards are subject to regular vesting schedules to help ensure that a significant component of executive compensation is tied to long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has also reviewed Apples compensation programs for employees generally and has concluded these programs do not create risks that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that Apples annual cash and long-term equity awards provide an effective and appropriate mix of incentives to help ensure Apples performance is focused on long-term shareholder value creation and do not encourage short-term risk taking at the expense of long-term results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Financial Experts
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each member of the Audit Committee qualifies as an audit committee financial expert as defined under applicable SEC rules and also meets the additional criteria for independence of audit committee members set forth in Rule 10A-3(b)(1) under the Exchange Act.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has a code of ethics, Business Conduct: The way we do business worldwide, that applies to all employees, including Apples principal executive officer, principal financial officer, and principal accounting officer, to the Board, and to independent contractors, consultants, and others who do business with Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The code is available at investor.apple.com/ corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple intends to disclose any changes in this code or waivers from this code that apply to Apples principal executive officer, principal financial officer, or principal accounting officer by posting such information on the same website or by filing with the SEC a Current Report on Form 8-K, in each case if such disclosure is required by rules of the SEC or NASDAQ.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review, Approval, or Ratification of Transactions with Related Persons
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a written policy for approval of transactions between Apple and its directors, director nominees, executive officers, greater than 5% beneficial owners, and each of their respective immediate family members, where the amount involved in the transaction exceeds or is expected to exceed $120,000 in a single calendar year and the party to the transaction has or will have a direct or indirect interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of this policy is available at investor.apple.com/corporate- governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy provides that the Audit Committee reviews transactions subject to the policy and determines whether or not to approve or ratify those transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Audit Committee has delegated authority to the Chair of the Audit Committee to pre-approve or ratify transactions under certain circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing transactions subject to the policy, the Audit Committee, or the Chair of the Audit Committee, as applicable, considers among other factors it deems appropriate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The related persons interest in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approximate dollar value of the amount involved in the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approximate dollar value of the amount of the related persons interest in the transaction without regard to the amount of any profit or loss;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the transaction was undertaken in the ordinary course of business of Apple;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the transaction with the related person is proposed to be, or was, entered into on terms no less favorable to Apple than terms that could have been reached with an unrelated third-party;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of, and the potential benefits to Apple of, the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Required public disclosure, if any; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 21
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other information regarding the transaction or the related person in the context of the proposed transaction that would be material to investors in light of the circumstances of the particular transaction.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has considered and adopted the following standing pre-approvals under the policy for transactions with related persons:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Employment as an executive officer of Apple, if the related compensation is approved (or recommended to the Board for approval) by the Compensation Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any compensation paid to a director if the compensation is consistent with Apples director compensation policies and is required to be reported in Apples proxy statement under Item 402 of SEC Regulation S-K;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any transaction with another company at which a related persons only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer or director) or beneficial owner of less than 10% of that companys equity, if the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the greater of $1 million, or 2% of that companys total annual revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any charitable contribution, grant, or endowment by Apple to a charitable organization, foundation, or university at which a related persons only relationship is as an employee (other than an executive officer or director), if the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the greater of $1 million, or 2% of the charitable organizations total annual receipts; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any transaction where the related persons interest arises solely from the ownership of Apples common stock and all holders of Apples common stock received the same benefit on a pro-rata basis, such as dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of new transactions covered by the standing pre-approvals, or approved or ratified by the Chair of the Audit Committee, if any, is provided to the Audit Committee for its review at each regularly scheduled Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of the Board who are not also Apple employees (Non-Employee Directors) receive compensation for their service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cook, our CEO, does not receive any compensation for his service as a member of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee annually reviews the total compensation of our Non-Employee Directors and each element of our Non- Employee Director compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of this process, the Compensation Committee evaluates market data provided by its independent compensation consulting firm, Pay Governance LLC, and makes a recommendation to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board determines the form and amount of director compensation after reviewing the Compensation Committees recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Retainers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Directors receive an annual cash retainer of $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Chairman of the Board, Dr. Levinson, received an additional cash retainer of $200,000; the Chair of the Audit Committee, Dr. Sugar, received an additional cash retainer of $35,000; the Chair of the Compensation Committee, Ms. Jung, received an additional cash retainer of $30,000; and the Chair of the Nominating Committee, Mr. Iger, received an additional cash retainer of $25,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All retainers are paid in quarterly installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-Based Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A substantial portion of each Non-Employee Directors annual retainer is in the form of equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Apples 1997 Director Stock Plan (the Director Plan), Non-Employee Directors are granted restricted stock units (RSUs) on the date of each annual meeting of shareholders (each, an Annual Director Award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Annual Director Awards vest on February 1 of the following year, subject to continued service on the Board through the vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the number of RSUs subject to each Annual Director Award was determined by dividing $250,000 by the per share closing price of Apples common stock on the date of grant and rounding to the nearest whole share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Non-Employee Director who is newly appointed to the Board other than in connection with an annual meeting of shareholders will receive a grant of RSUs upon appointment (an Initial Director Award), except that a Non-Employee Director who joins the Board after February 1 of a particular year and prior to the annual meeting for that year will not receive an Initial Director Award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of RSUs subject to each Initial Director Award is determined in the same manner as described above for Annual Director Awards, but the grant date fair value of the award is pro-rated based on the portion of the year that has passed since the last annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Initial Director Awards are scheduled to vest on the next February 1 following the award.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Directors do not have the right to vote or dispose of the RSUs subject to these awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Apple pays an ordinary cash dividend on its common stock, each RSU award granted under the Director Plan will be credited with an amount equal to the per share cash dividend paid by Apple, multiplied by the total number of RSUs subject to the award that are outstanding immediately prior to the record date for such dividend.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts that are credited to each award are referred to as dividend equivalents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any dividend equivalents credited to an award granted under the Director Plan will be subject to the same vesting, payment, and other terms and conditions as the unvested RSUs to which the dividend equivalents relate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The crediting of dividend equivalents is meant to treat the RSU award holders consistently with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equipment Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has an equipment program for the Board under which each Non-Employee Director is eligible to receive, upon request and free of charge, one of each new product introduced by Apple, and is eligible to purchase additional equipment at a discount.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-Employee Directors do not receive any other compensation for serving on any committee or attending Board or committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the guidelines, Non-Employee Directors are expected to own shares of Apple common stock that have a value equal to five times their annual cash retainer for serving as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares may be owned directly by the individual, owned jointly with or separately by the individuals spouse, or held in trust for the benefit of the individual, the individuals

sentences.text: Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has reviewed and discussed with management the disclosures contained in the following Compensation Discussion and Analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review and discussion, the Compensation Committee recommended to the Board that the section entitled Compensation Discussion and Analysis be included in this Proxy Statement for the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Andrea Jung (Chair) | Al Gore | Bob Iger

sentences.text: Compensation Discussion and Analysis
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple had another year of strong financial results in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales were $215.6 billion and operating income was $60.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales of our Services business grew 22% year-over-year and App Store revenue was the highest ever.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation paid to our named executive officers for 2016 appropriately reflects and rewards this performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this Compensation Discussion and Analysis, we discuss the 2016 compensation program for our named executive officers and the guiding principles and practices upon which it is based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our named executive officers for 2016 were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tim Cook Chief Executive Officer Luca Maestri Senior Vice President, Chief Financial Officer Angela Ahrendts Senior Vice President, Retail Eddy Cue Senior Vice President, Internet Software and Services Dan Riccio Senior Vice President, Hardware Engineering Bruce Sewell Senior Vice President, General Counsel and Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cue, Mr. Riccio, and Mr. Sewell had the same total compensation according to SEC reporting rules, and as a result, we are reporting six named executive officers for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Guiding Principles and Compensation Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to attract, motivate, and retain a talented, entrepreneurial, and creative team of executives who will provide leadership for Apples success in dynamic and competitive markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a pay-for- performance philosophy for executive compensation based on the following principles:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Team-Based Approach.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are expected to operate as a high-performing team, and accordingly, we apply a team-based approach to our executive compensation program with internal pay equity as a primary consideration.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that generally awarding the same base salary, annual cash incentive, and long-term equity awards to each of our executive officers, other than the CEO, successfully supports this goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance Expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have clear performance expectations of our executive team, and the design of our executive compensation program reflects these expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: First, each executive officer must demonstrate exceptional personal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 28
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: performance in order to remain part of the executive team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that individuals who underperform should either be removed from the executive team with their compensation adjusted accordingly, or be dismissed from Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Second, each executive officer must contribute to Apples overall success rather than focus solely on specific objectives within his or her primary area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Emphasis on Long-Term Equity Incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program emphasizes long-term shareholder value creation by using both time-based and performance-based RSUs to deliver long-term compensation incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that this is the most effective way to attract and retain a talented executive team and align executives interests with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, our executive compensation program is weighted considerably toward long-term equity awards rather than cash compensation and our executives hold significant unvested RSUs at any particular time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice is intended to create a substantial retention incentive, encourage our executives to focus on Apples long-term success, and align with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We follow sound compensation practices to support our guiding principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control Payments  We do not offer change in control payments or gross-ups of related excise taxes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Compensation Consultant  Our Compensation Committee has directly retained an independent compensation consultant, which performs no services for Apple other than services for the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Special Perquisites  We do not provide executive perquisites that are not available to other employees generally.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management  We prohibit short sales, transactions in derivatives of Apple securities, including hedging transactions, and pledging of shares by all executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also conducts an annual compensation risk assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement Vesting  We do not include retirement acceleration provisions in equity awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Re-Pricing  We do not allow re-pricing of stock options without shareholder approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines  We have robust stock ownership guidelines for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pension or Other Special Benefits  We do not provide pensions or supplemental executive retirement, health, or insurance benefits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity Clawback  Our RSU agreements have a recoupment provision requiring repayment to Apple of any shares or other amount that may be paid in respect of RSUs in the event of certain acts of misconduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based, Long-Term Equity  We emphasize long-term equity awards with a substantial performance-based component in our pay mix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting and Performance Conditions on Dividend Equivalents  We apply the same vesting restrictions and performance conditions on dividend equivalents as on the underlying RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At-Will Employment  We employ our executive officers at will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 29
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discretion and Judgment of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, consisting entirely of independent directors, reviews and approves the compensation of Apples executive officers and acts as the administering committee for Apples equity compensation plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee conducts an evaluation of Apples executive compensation program to determine if any changes would be appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making these determinations, the Compensation Committee may consult with its independent compensation consultant and management, as described below; however, the Compensation Committee uses its own judgment in making final decisions regarding the compensation paid to our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Compensation Consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee selects and retains the services of its own independent compensation consultant and annually reviews the performance of the selected consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of the review process, the Compensation Committee considers the independence of the consultant in accordance with SEC and NASDAQ rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2014, the Compensation Committee has engaged the services of Pay Governance, an independent compensation consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Pay Governance provided no services to Apple other than services for the Compensation Committee, and worked with Apples management, as directed by the Compensation Committee, only on matters for which the Compensation Committee is responsible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Compensation Committees request, Pay Governance regularly attends Compensation Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Governance also communicates with the Chair of the Compensation Committee outside committee meetings regarding matters related to the Compensation Committees responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee generally sought input from Pay Governance on a range of external market factors, including evolving compensation trends, appropriate peer companies, and market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Governance also provided general observations about Apples compensation programs and management recommendations regarding the amount and form of compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Compensation Committees request, Mr. Cook provides input regarding the performance and appropriate compensation of the other executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers Mr. Cooks evaluation of the other executive officers because of his direct knowledge of each executive officers performance and contributions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cook is not present during voting or deliberations by the Compensation Committee regarding his own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of Peer Companies and Benchmarking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews peer group composition each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the assistance of Pay Governance, the Compensation Committee identified groups of companies to serve as market reference points for compensation comparison purposes for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A primary peer group was developed for reference consisting of U.S.-based, stand-alone, publicly traded companies in the technology, media, and internet services industries that, in the Compensation Committees view, compete with Apple for talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A secondary peer group of premier companies that have iconic brands or are industry or category leaders, rely on significant R&D and innovation for growth, and require highly-skilled human capital was also considered as an additional reference set for the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies in each peer group are listed below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless otherwise specified, references in this Compensation Discussion and Analysis to peer companies include both the primary and the secondary peer group companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.

sentences.text: In June 2015, the Compensation Committee selected the following companies for the 2016 primary peer group:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amazon.com Disney IBM Time Warner Cable AT&T eBay Intel Twenty-First Century Fox CBS EMC Microsoft Verizon Cisco Systems Facebook Oracle Viacom Comcast Google (now Alphabet) Qualcomm DIRECTV Hewlett-Packard Time Warner

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the revenue and market capitalization criteria described above, Apple continues to be significantly larger than the companies selected for the 2016 primary peer group, with 2016 revenue of $215.6 billion and market capitalization of $601.4 billion as of the end of 2016.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee reviews compensation practices and program design at peer companies to inform its decision-making process so it can set total compensation levels that it believes are commensurate with Apples scope and performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, however, does not set compensation components to meet specific benchmarks as compared to peer companies, such as targeting salaries at a specific market percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that over-reliance on benchmarking can result in compensation that is unrelated to the value delivered by our executive officers because compensation benchmarking does not take into account the specific performance of the executive officers or the relative size and performance of Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees executive compensation determinations are subjective and the result of the Compensation Committees business judgment, which is informed by the experiences of the members of the Compensation Committee as well as input from, and peer group data provided by, the Compensation Committees independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the feedback provided by our shareholders and have discussions with many of them on an ongoing basis regarding various corporate governance topics, including executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are also provided the opportunity to cast an annual advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Apples 2016 annual meeting of shareholders, shareholders indicated their support for the compensation of our named executive officers, with approximately 95% of the votes cast on the say-on-pay proposal voted for the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The design of the 2016 executive compensation program follows the same design as 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for 2017, the Compensation Committee has continued to evolve our executive compensation program by changing the allocation of equity awards to our executive officers from 60% time-based and 40% performance-based RSUs to 50% time-based and 50% performance-based RSUs, thereby placing an even greater emphasis on performance-based equity awards for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee will continue to consider shareholder feedback and the results of say-on-pay votes when making future compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Named Executive Officer Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to be simple, effective, and link pay to performance, while reflecting the size, scope, and success of Apples business, as well as the responsibilities of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It incorporates elements that create shareholder value by driving financial performance, retaining a high-performing and talented executive team, and aligning the interests of the executive team with the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The main elements of the executive compensation program are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual cash incentive

sentences.text: Long-term equity incentives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Compensation Elements and Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary is a customary, fixed element of compensation intended to attract and retain executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers market data provided by its independent compensation consultant, internal pay equity among the executive officers, and Apples financial results and market capitalization relative to the peer companies when setting base salaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Taking these factors into consideration and in recognition of his individual performance and remarkable leadership, Mr. Cooks base salary was increased to $3 million at the beginning of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The base salary for each of our named executive officers, other than Mr. Cook, remained unchanged at $1 million for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee approves, on an annual basis, a performance-based cash incentive opportunity for our executive officers based on the achievement of annual financial performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, each of our named executive officers had a threshold annual cash incentive opportunity of 100% of base salary, a target annual cash incentive opportunity of 200% of base salary, and a maximum annual cash incentive opportunity of 400% of base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net sales and operating income, as determined in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, were chosen as the performance measures for the 2016 annual cash incentive opportunity because they reflect commonly recognized measures of overall company performance and are drivers of shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts of the annual cash incentive are determined based on an equal weighting for the net sales and operating income measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There is no payout for a particular performance measure unless the threshold performance goal is achieved with respect to that measure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts are calculated based on the performance level achieved for each performance measure for 2016 and are linearly interpolated for achievement between the threshold, target, and maximum goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee may, in its discretion, reduce (but not increase) the actual payout of any individuals annual cash incentive based on Apples performance and the Compensation Committees subjective assessment of the named executive officers overall performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee established performance goals in the first quarter of 2016, taking into consideration Apples 2015 financial results, macroeconomic factors, the payout opportunities based on attainment of performance goals at threshold, target, and maximum levels, and pay-for-performance alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
