sentences.text: Long-Term Equity Elements and Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program emphasizes long-term shareholder value creation through the use of equity awards in the form of RSUs to deliver long-term compensation incentives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has discretion to approve awards with different vesting conditions as it deems necessary to meet the objectives of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance-Based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of performance-based RSUs granted to our named executive officers that vest depends on Apples total shareholder return relative to the other companies in the S&P 500 for the performance period (Relative TSR).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee chose Relative TSR as a straightforward and objective metric for Apples shareholders to evaluate our performance against the performance of other companies and to align the interests of our named executive officers with the interests of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measure Relative TSR for a specified period of time based on the change in each companys stock price during that period, taking into account any dividends paid during that period, which are assumed to be reinvested in the stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The change in value from the beginning to the end of the period is divided by the beginning value to determine total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples total shareholder return is compared to the total shareholder return of other companies, ranked by percentile, to determine the number of performance-based RSUs that vest for each performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An averaging period is used to determine the beginning and ending stock price values used to calculate Relative TSR for the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This mitigates the impact on the long-term Relative TSR results of one-day or short-term stock price fluctuations at the beginning or end of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The beginning stock price value is calculated using each companys average closing stock price for the 20 consecutive trading days immediately prior to the beginning of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The ending stock price value is calculated using each companys average closing price for the 20 consecutive trading days ending on the last day of the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Time-Based RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards with time-based vesting align the interests of our executives with the interests of our shareholders and promote the stability and retention of a strong executive team over the longer term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vesting schedules for time-based awards generally require continuous service over multiple years, as described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 34
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cooks Long-Term Equity Award
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Cook last received an equity award when he was promoted to Chief Executive Officer in 2011 (the 2011 RSU Award).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Mr. Cooks request, the 2011 RSU Award was modified in 2013 to put a portion of the award at risk based on Apples Relative TSR performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance condition requires Apple to outperform two-thirds of the comparative companies in the S&P 500 for each performance period in order for 100% of the performance-based RSUs allocated to that period to vest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2011 RSU Award only has downside risk to Mr. Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It does not contain an upside vesting opportunity, and there is no interpolation for results between the Relative TSR percentile levels set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR Percentile v. S&P 500 Companies Performance-Based RSUs Vesting Top Third 100% Middle Third 50% Bottom Third 0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the three-year performance period from August 25, 2013 through August 24, 2016, 280,000 performance-based RSUs were subject to the Relative TSR performance condition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Relative TSR for this performance period was at the 78th percentile of the companies that were included in the S&P 500 for the entire performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, all of the 280,000 performance-based RSUs vested on August 24, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Named Executive Officers Long-Term Equity Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2015, the Compensation Committee awarded RSUs with a grant date fair value of $20 million (the Annual RSU Awards) to each of our named executive officers, other than Mr. Cook.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual RSU Awards were allocated between 60% time-based and 40% performance-based RSUs as a percentage of the grant date fair value reported in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value and relative mix of the Annual RSU Awards was a subjective determination by the Compensation Committee based on its own business judgment after taking into consideration factors such as market compensation data provided by its independent compensation consultant, its subjective assessment of the appropriate relationship between time- and performance-based awards, historical equity grants, and, with respect to the value of the awards, financial results and market capitalization compared to peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual RSU Awards granted as performance-based RSUs in October 2015 have a three-year performance-period (fiscal years 2016 through 2018) and will vest on October 1, 2018, subject to continued employment through that date, with zero to 200% of the target number of shares vesting depending on Apples Relative TSR percentile ranking for the performance period, as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relative TSR Percentile v. S&P 500 Companies Performance-Based RSUs Vesting as a Percentage of Target 85th or above 200% 55th 100% 25th 25% below 25th 0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This vesting schedule requires Relative TSR performance at the 25th percentile to vest in the threshold number of shares, Relative TSR performance at the 55th percentile to vest in the target number of shares, and Relative TSR performance that is significantly above the median at the 85th percentile in order to vest in the maximum 200% of the target number of shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 35
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No RSUs vest if Apples Relative TSR performance is below the 25th percentile.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, if Apples total shareholder return for the performance period is negative, the number of RSUs that vests is capped at 100% of the target number of shares regardless of our percentile ranking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If Apples Relative TSR percentile ranking is above the 25th percentile and between the levels shown in the table above, the portion of the RSUs that vests is linearly interpolated between the two nearest vesting percentages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Mr. Maestri vested in performance-based RSUs that were granted on May 29, 2014 in connection with his promotion to Chief Financial Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the 16-month performance period from May 29, 2014 through the end of 2015, Apples Relative TSR was at the 85th percentile of the companies that were included in the S&P 500 for the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, Mr. Maestri vested in 15,918 performance-based RSUs on October 1, 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the beginning of 2017, for the 28-month period from May 29, 2014 through the end of 2016, Mr. Maestri vested in 10,694 performance-based RSUs based on Apples Relative TSR at the 67th percentile of the companies that were included in the S&P 500 for the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, Ms. Ahrendts vested in performance-based RSUs that were granted on May 1, 2014 in connection with her hiring.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the two-year performance period from May 1, 2014 through April 30, 2016, Apples Relative TSR was at the 81st percentile of the companies that were included in the S&P 500 for the period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual RSU Awards granted as time-based RSUs in October 2015 vest in three equal annual installments commencing on April 1, 2018 (approximately two and one-half years following the grant date), subject to continued employment through each applicable vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This schedule means that, to receive the full benefit of the time-based RSU award, the recipient must generally perform four and one-half years of continuous service following the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The April vesting dates for the time-based RSUs were selected to balance the October vesting of the performance-based RSUs and provide regular vesting intervals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In October 2016, the Compensation Committee took into consideration a number of factors, including shareholder feedback, and increased the performance-based component of the 2017 Annual RSU Awards to 50% of the grant date fair value, placing an even greater emphasis on performance-based compensation for our executive officers.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Mr. Cooks request, none of his RSUs participate in dividend equivalents.

sentences.text: All other unvested RSUs granted to Apple employees have dividend equivalents.

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents entitle holders of RSUs to the same dividend value per share as holders of common stock.

sentences.text: Dividend equivalents are subject to the same vesting and other terms and conditions as the corresponding unvested RSUs.

sentences.text: Other Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are eligible to participate in our health and welfare programs, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, 401(k) Plan, matching gifts program, vacation cash-out, and other benefit programs on the same basis as other employees.

sentences.text: Security.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The personal safety and security of our employees is of the utmost importance to Apple and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we provide risk-based, business-related security services to our employees, including our named executive officers, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although not requested by Mr. Cook, given the profile of the company and Mr. Cooks role as CEO, Apple also provides risk-based personal security services for him, as determined to be appropriate by our security team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not consider these security measures to be a personal benefit for Mr. Cook, but rather a reasonable and necessary expense for the benefit of Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also offer risk-based personal security assistance to members of our executive team based on the highly visible nature of their roles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate incremental cost of these services is reported in the Summary Compensation Table in accordance with SEC disclosure rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relocation Assistance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Relocation assistance, including a gross-up for taxable relocation benefits, is provided to employees when necessary based on business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ahrendts was provided relocation assistance to move closer to Apples headquarters in connection with her hiring.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some of these relocation expenses were incurred in 2016 and are reported in the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally do not enter into severance arrangements with our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An exception to this practice was made in connection with hiring Ms. Ahrendts in May 2014 in recognition of the risk she assumed by leaving her prior role as Chief Executive Officer of Burberry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Ahrendts has a limited cash severance arrangement until May 2017 and equity acceleration for a portion of her outstanding equity awards, in each case, in the event of a termination by Apple other than for Cause, or if she resigns for Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Details of the arrangement with Ms. Ahrendts are described under Executive CompensationExecutive Compensation Tables in the section entitled Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chartered Aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From time to time, members of the executive team, including each of the named executive officers, may request chartered aircraft services to facilitate travel that is directly and integrally related to the performance of their job duties and when the use of a chartered plane will increase efficiency or security associated with a particular trip.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occasionally, spouses or other family members may accompany an executive on these flights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When this occurs, we require the executive to pay the greater of the incremental cost, if any, to accommodate these guests on the flight or the imputed income amount determined using the IRS Standard Industry Fare Level (SIFL) rate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, there is no incremental cost to Apple for family accompaniment on chartered business flights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance and Other Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tax Deductibility of Compensation Expense.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code places a $1 million limit on the amount of compensation a company can deduct in any one year for compensation paid to the chief executive officer and the three most highly-compensated executive officers employed by the company at the end of the year (other than the chief financial officer).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the $1 million deduction limit generally does not apply to compensation that is performance-based and provided under a shareholder-approved plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Compensation Committee considers the deductibility of awards as one factor in determining executive compensation, the Compensation Committee also looks at other factors in making its decisions, as noted above, and retains the flexibility to award compensation that it determines to be consistent with the goals of our executive compensation program even if the awards are not deductible by Apple for tax purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In general, the 2016 annual cash incentive opportunities for executive officers have been designed in a manner intended to be exempt from the deduction limitation of Section 162(m) because they are paid based on achievement of pre-determined performance goals established by the Compensation Committee pursuant to our shareholder-approved equity incentive plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of the modification of Mr. Cooks 2011 RSU Award, we intend that the tranches of the award subject to performance criteria with measurement periods that begin after the June 21, 2013 modification be exempt from the deduction limitation of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the performance-based RSU awards granted to our other named executive officers in 2016 are also intended to be exempt from the deduction limitation of Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 37
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base salary and RSU awards with only time-based vesting requirements, which represent a portion of the equity awards granted to our executive officers, are not exempt from Section 162(m), and therefore will not be deductible to the extent the $1 million limit of Section 162(m) is exceeded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite the Compensation Committees efforts to structure the executive team annual cash incentives and performance- based RSUs in a manner intended to be exempt from Section 162(m) and therefore not subject to its deduction limits, because of ambiguities and uncertainties as to the application and interpretation of Section 162(m) and the regulations issued thereunder, no assurance can be given that compensation we intend to satisfy the requirements for exemption from Section 162(m) in fact will.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Compensation Committee reserves the right to modify compensation that was initially intended to be exempt from Section 162(m) if it determines that such modifications are consistent with Apples business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recoupment of RSUs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The named executive officers RSUs are granted pursuant to the terms of our standard RSU agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These terms require an employee to deliver or otherwise repay to Apple any shares or other amount that may be paid in respect of RSUs in the event the employee commits a felony while employed by Apple, or engages in a breach of confidentiality, commits an act of theft, embezzlement or fraud, or materially breaches any agreement with Apple while employed by Apple or at any time thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prohibition on Hedging, Pledging, and Short Sales.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We prohibit transactions in derivatives of Apple stock, including hedging transactions, for all directors, officers, employees, consultants, and contractors of Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we prohibit pledging of Apple stock as collateral by directors and executive officers of Apple and prohibit short sales of Apple stock by directors and executive officers of Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our stock ownership guidelines, Mr. Cook is expected to own shares of Apple stock that have a value equal to ten times his base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although Mr. Cook was required to satisfy the stock ownership guidelines within five years of its implementation in 2012, he already owns shares with a value significantly in excess of the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All other executive officers are expected to own shares that have a value equal to three times their base salary by the later of February 6, 2018, or within five years after an officer first becomes subject to the guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares may be owned directly by the individual, owned jointly with or separately by the individuals spouse, or held in trust for the benefit of the individual, the individuals spouse or children.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Considerations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considers, in establishing and reviewing the executive compensation program, whether the program encourages unnecessary or excessive risk-taking and has concluded that it does not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See the section entitled Board Oversight of Risk Management above for an additional discussion of risk considerations.

sentences.text: We generally do not enter into severance arrangements with our named executive officers, and none of the equity awards granted to the named executive officers under Apples equity incentive plans provide for acceleration in connection with a change in control or a termination of employment, other than as noted below or in connection with death or disability.

sentences.text: As described under Executive CompensationCompensation Discussion and Analysis in the section entitled Other Benefits, Ms. Ahrendts was provided a limited cash severance arrangement when she joined Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Within the first three years of her start date, if we terminate Ms. Ahrendts employment other than for Cause or if she resigns for Good Reason, we will pay her as severance the amount of her final base salary for the remainder of the three-year period in a single lump sum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this arrangement, the severance value declines to zero by May 1, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the vesting of the RSUs awarded to Ms. Ahrendts to compensate her for her unvested equity at Burberry, where she previously served as Chief Executive Officer (the Make Whole RSUs), is accelerated if Apple terminates her employment other than for Cause or if she resigns for Good Reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Had Ms. Ahrendts employment terminated on September 23, 2016, the last business day of Apples fiscal year, the estimated amount that she would have been entitled to under the cash severance arrangement would have been $597,260, and the estimated amount she would have been entitled to under the Make Whole RSUs would have been $2,961,004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause and Good Reason are defined in Ms. Ahrendts offer letter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause generally means an act of fraud or material dishonesty; gross misconduct; failure to follow the lawful direction of the CEO or Board; failure to perform material duties for Apple; or material breach of an Apple policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good Reason generally means a material change in duties or responsibilities; a change in the reporting structure such that Ms. Ahrendts no longer reports to the CEO; a material change in primary work location; or a breach by Apple of any of its material commitments in connection with Ms. Ahrendts employment.

sentences.text: The Board has nominated directors Bell, Cook, Gore, Iger, Jung, Levinson, Sugar, and Wagner to be elected to serve until the next annual meeting of shareholders and until their successors are duly elected and qualified.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 2  Ratification of Appointment of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has re-appointed Ernst & Young LLP as Apples independent registered public accounting firm and as auditors of Apples consolidated financial statements for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ernst & Young has served as Apples independent registered public accounting firm since 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews the performance of the independent registered public accounting firm annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the Annual Meeting, our shareholders are being asked to ratify the appointment of Ernst & Young as Apples independent registered public accounting firm for 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event of a negative vote on this proposal, the Audit Committee will reconsider its selection.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if this appointment is ratified, the Audit Committee may, in its discretion, direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if the Audit Committee determines that such a change would be in the best interests of Apple and its shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Ernst & Young are expected to be present at the Annual Meeting, will have an opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so, and will be available to respond to questions.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Audit fees relate to professional services rendered in connection with the audit of Apples annual financial statements and internal control over financial reporting, quarterly review of financial statements included in Apples Quarterly Reports on Form 10-Q, and audit services provided in connection with other statutory and regulatory filings.

sentences.text: (2) Audit-related fees relate to professional services that are reasonably related to the performance of the audit or review of Apples financial statements.

sentences.text: Policy on Audit Committee Pre-Approval of Audit and Non-Audit Services Performed by the Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple maintains an auditor independence policy that, among other things, prohibits Apples independent registered public accounting firm from performing non-financial consulting services, such as information technology consulting and internal audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy mandates that the Audit Committee approve in advance the audit and permissible non-audit services to be performed by the independent registered public accounting firm and the related budget, and that the Audit Committee be provided with quarterly reporting on actual spending.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy also mandates that Apple may not enter into engagements with Apples independent registered public accounting firm for non-audit services without the express pre-approval of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with this policy, the Audit Committee pre-approved all services performed by Apples independent registered public accounting firm in 2016.

sentences.text: Proposal No. 3  Advisory Vote to Approve Executive Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the requirements of Section 14A of the Exchange Act and the related rules of the SEC, our shareholders have the opportunity to cast an annual advisory vote to approve the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed pursuant to the SECs compensation disclosure rules, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables, and the narrative disclosures that accompany the compensation tables (a say-on-pay proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to be simple, effective, and link pay to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reflects the size, scope, and success of Apples business, as well as the responsibilities of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our compensation program appropriately rewards performance and is aligned with the long-term interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage shareholders to read the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, beginning on page 28 of this Proxy Statement, which describes the details of our executive compensation program and the decisions made by the Compensation Committee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We had another year of strong financial results in 2016 with net sales of $215.6 billion and operating income of $60.0 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These two financial measures are used to evaluate executive performance under our annual cash incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, these measures declined from our record-breaking 2015 levels, and were below the target performance goals set by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The annual cash incentives paid to our named executive officers for 2016 reflected these results with below-target payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the annual cash incentives are intended to reward the achievement of short-term financial goals, our executive compensation program emphasizes and rewards results over the long-term through equity incentives that have a substantial performance-based component and multi-year vesting schedules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2017, we placed an even greater emphasis on long-term performance by increasing the performance-based component of our equity incentives to 50%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also implemented robust stock ownership guidelines that apply to all executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value the feedback provided by our shareholders, who supported our executive compensation program at the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders with approximately 95% of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have discussions with many of our shareholders on an ongoing basis regarding various corporate governance topics, including executive compensation, and take into account the views of shareholders regarding the design and effectiveness of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are being asked to approve the following resolution at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the compensation paid to the named executive officers, as disclosed in this Proxy Statement pursuant to the SECs executive compensation disclosure rules (which disclosure includes the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables, and the narrative disclosures that accompany the compensation tables), is hereby approved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding on Apple, the Board, or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee and the Board value the opinions expressed by shareholders in their votes on this proposal and will consider the outcome of the vote when making future compensation decisions regarding named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is expected that the next say-on-pay vote will occur at the 2018 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote FOR Proposal No. 3.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority of the shares required to constitute a quorum.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 52
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal No. 4  Advisory Vote on Frequency of Say-on-Pay Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As described in Proposal No. 3 above, in accordance with the requirements of Section 14A of the Exchange Act and the related rules of the SEC, our shareholders have the opportunity to cast an advisory vote to approve the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Proposal No. 4 affords shareholders the opportunity to cast an advisory vote on how often we should include a say-on-pay proposal in our proxy materials for future annual shareholder meetings or any special shareholder meeting for which we must include executive compensation information in the proxy statement for that meeting (a say-on-pay frequency proposal).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this Proposal No. 4, shareholders may vote to have the say-on-pay vote every year, every two years, or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our shareholders voted on a similar proposal in 2011 with the majority voting to hold the say-on-pay vote every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to believe that say-on-pay votes should be conducted every year so that our shareholders may annually express their views on our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding on Apple, the Board, or the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Compensation Committee and the Board value the opinions expressed by shareholders in their votes on this proposal and will consider the outcome of the vote when making future decisions regarding the frequency of conducting a say-on-pay vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is expected that the next vote on a say-on-pay frequency proposal will occur at the 2023 annual meeting of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may cast their advisory vote to conduct advisory votes on executive compensation every 1 Year, 2 Years, or 3 Years, or Abstain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote on Proposal No. 4 to hold say-on-pay votes every 1 YEAR (as opposed to 2 years or 3 years).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A plurality of the votes cast for Proposal No. 4 will determine the shareholders preferred frequency for holding an advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This means that the option for holding an advisory vote every 1 year, 2 years, or 3 years receiving the greatest number of votes will be considered the preferred frequency of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has been advised that the National Center for Public Policy Research, 20 F Street, NW, Suite 700, Washington, DC 20001, which has indicated it is a beneficial owner of at least $2,000 in market value of Apples common stock, intends to submit the following proposal at the Annual Meeting:

sentences.text: Charitable Giving  Recipients, Intents and Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whereas, in addition to providing benefits to society at-large, charitable contributions should enhance the public image of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increased disclosure about these contributions would provide shareholders with better insight into our corporate giving strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: The proponent requests that the company provide an annual report, omitting proprietary information and at reasonable cost, disclosing: the companys standards for choosing recipients of company assets in the form of charitable contributions; the business rationale and purpose for each of the charitable contributions, if any; personnel participating in the decision to contribute; the benefits to society at-large produced by company contributions; and a follow-up report confirming the contribution was used for the purpose stated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The report should be published on the companys website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Absent a system of accountability and transparency, some donated assets may be misused and potentially harm the companys reputation and shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current disclosure is insufficient to allow the companys Board and shareholders to evaluate the use of corporate assets by outside organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, the company has donated to the Center for American Progress (CAP)  an openly left-wing organization that, as reported by the Washington Post, made statements the head of the Anti-Defamation League called anti-Semitic and borderline anti-Semitic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Many support CAPs leftist policy work, many others do not.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most Americans would acknowledge that donating to an extremely ideological organization in this highly polarized political climate is controversial.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, while education advocates would likely applaud the companys donations of iPads and other equipment to schools through its ConnectED program, certain labor unions and their political allies would likely oppose the companys ConnectED donations to charter schools.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, according to public reports, the company donated to the Clinton Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public reports indicate that the FBI is investigating or has investigated that organization for possible public corruption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Media reports also strongly imply that individuals and corporations may have sought preferential treatment from government actors in exchange for donations to the Clinton Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Clinton Foundation has many supporters who would support the companys donation, but it also has many detractors that would disapprove of this type of giving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fuller disclosure would provide enhanced feedback opportunities from which our company could make more fruitful decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate philanthropy should be transparent to better serve the interests of the shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple already provides detailed information about our core values and our most significant charitable contributions on our website at apple.com/diversity/creating-opportunities and apple.com/product-red.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples largest charitable contributions, which are made only following extensive internal vetting and approval from one or more of our executive officers, focus on some of the most important issues facing our communities today.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple supports the advancement of education.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has joined President Obamas ConnectED initiative and pledged $100 million to bring technology and services into 114 underserved schools across the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under this program, we are donating an iPad to every student, a Mac and iPad to every teacher, and an Apple TV to every classroom, as well as services and professional development for teachers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are now more than 50,000 students learning, creating, and exploring on iPad through our ConnectED commitment, and 96% of those students are eligible for a free or reduced-price lunch program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple supports health in the fight for an AIDS-free generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When our customers buy (PRODUCT)REDApple products, Apple contributes to the Global Fund to provide counseling, testing, and medical care to those most affected by the AIDS epidemic.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: So far, (PRODUCT)RED has raised over $360 million for the Global Fund, including nearly $120 million through Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple supports inclusion and diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has launched a multiyear, $40 million partnership with the Thurgood Marshall College Fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The TMCF in turn creates opportunities for students from public and private historically black colleges and universities who are pursuing careers in the tech industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple does not just give money to the TMCF; we work collaboratively with the fund to advance its goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Apple hired 33 students from these institutions as summer interns in 2016, and as part of the TMCF partnership, also hosted them for a weeklong immersion at Apples campus several months ahead of time to provide them with a foundation of Apple culture and values to help pave the way for a successful experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple publicly discloses detailed information about the cost and impact of these initiatives on our website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple also supports many other organizations that share our core values, such as American Red Cross, The Conservation Fund, Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing, Mercy Corps, National Center for Women & Information Technology, National Society of Black Engineers, and World Wildlife Fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In September 2011, Apple implemented a matching gifts program where Apple matches employee contributions of money, Apple products, or volunteer time to eligible nonprofit organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In certain cases, Apple matches cash contributions on a 2-for-1 basis, such as in cases of natural disasters or other major humanitarian crises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has contributed to more than 11,000 different charitable organizations through this matching gifts program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes in leaving the world better than we found it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We actively support our communities through philanthropic activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The requested report would do nothing to advance these philanthropic activities, and would provide immaterial incremental additional information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes it is better to focus our efforts on actively supporting our communities than to divert time and resources to the preparation of a report that would have limited value to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 5.

sentences.text: The tech industry is characterized by the persistent and pervasive underrepresentation of minorities and women in senior positions as detailed in a 2014 U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission report.

sentences.text: According to a USA Today analysis of 2014 Computing Research Association data, [t]op universities turn out black and Hispanic computer science and computer engineering graduates at twice the rate that leading technology companies hire them.1

sentences.text: Apple has been advised that Mr. James McRitchie, 9295 Yorkship Court, Elk Grove, CA 95758, who has indicated he is a beneficial owner of at least $2,000 in market value of Apples common stock, intends to submit the following proposal at the Annual Meeting:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 7  Shareholder Proxy Access Amendments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders of Apple, Inc. (the Company) ask the board of directors (the Board) to amend its Proxy Access for Director Nominations bylaw, and any other associated documents, to include essential elements for substantial implementation to better facilitate meaningful proxy access by more shareholders as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. The number of Shareholder Nominees eligible to appear in proxy materials shall be 25% of the directors then serving or 2, whichever is greater.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current bylaws restrict Shareholder Nominees to 20% of directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the current 8-member board, shareholder nominees are currently limited to nominating one.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shareholder nominee elected under the current bylaws could be easily isolated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. No limitation shall be placed on the number of shareholders that can aggregate their shares to achieve the 3% Ownership Requirements for Eligible Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under current provisions, even if the 20 largest public pension funds were able to aggregate their shares, they would not meet the 3% criteria at most of companies examined by the Council of Institutional Investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Allowing an unlimited number of shareholders to aggregate shares will facilitate participation by individuals and institutional investors in meeting the Ownership Requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. No limitation shall be imposed on the re-nomination of Shareholder Nominees based on the number or percentage of votes received in any election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such limitations do not facilitate the shareholders traditional state law rights and add unnecessary complexity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SECs universal proxy access Rule 14a-11 (https://www.sec.gov/rules/final/2010/33-9136.pdf) was vacated after a court decision regarding the SECs cost-benefit analysis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, proxy access rights must be established on a company-by-company basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Subsequently, Proxy Access in the United States: Revisiting the Proposed SEC Rule (http://www.cfapubs.org/doi/pdf/10.2469/ccb.v2014.n9.1) a cost-benefit analysis by CFA Institute, found proxy access would benefit both the markets and corporate boardrooms, with little cost or disruption, raising US market capitalization by up to $140.3 billion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Public Versus Private Provision of Governance: The Case of Proxy Access (http://ssrn.com/abstract=2635695) found a 0.5 percent average increase in shareholder value for proxy access targeted firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Access: Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (http://www.cii.org/files/publications/misc/08_05_15_Best%20Practices%20-%20Proxy%20Access.pdf) by the Council of Institutional Investors, highlights the most troublesome provisions in recently implemented proxy access bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Companys board adopted a proxy access bylaw in 2015, it contains troublesome provisions, as outlined above, that significantly impair the ability of shareholders to participate as Eligible Shareholders, the ability of Shareholder Nominees to effectively serve if elected, and the ability of Shareholder Nominees to run again if they receive less than 25% of the vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adoption of all the requested amendments would largely remedy these issues and would better ensure meaningful proxy access by more shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increase shareholder value

sentences.text: Apples Statement in Opposition to Proposal No. 7
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our current corporate governance framework reflects our commitment to robust, balanced governance practices combined with responsiveness and accountability to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our existing proxy access bylaws, which Apple proactively adopted in 2015 and further enhanced in 2016, establishes a prudent and effective mechanism for proxy access, making adoption of this proposal unnecessary and unwarranted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, after careful consideration of the varying viewpoints and feedback offered by many shareholders, the Board amended Apples bylaws to adopt proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bylaws permit a shareholder, or a group of up to 20 shareholders, owning at least 3% of Apples outstanding shares of common stock continuously for at least three years, to nominate and include in Apples annual proxy materials director nominees constituting up to 20% of the Board, provided that the shareholder(s) and nominee(s) satisfy the procedural and eligibility requirements specified in the bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board currently consists of eight directors, and shareholders may nominate one proxy access candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: But we did not stop there.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After initially amending our bylaws to provide for proxy access, we continued to closely monitor proxy access developments and reach out to many of our largest shareholders, governance experts, and advisors to discuss evolving market practice and trends and the preferences of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result of these engagements, in December 2016, the Board adopted enhancements to Apples bylaws to streamline our proxy access framework and make it easier for shareholders to nominate proxy access candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These enhancements included the following changes:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple no longer requires shareholders who nominate a proxy access candidate to recall loaned shares and hold them through the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ownership of loaned shares is deemed to continue if the shareholder(s) has the power to recall the loaned shares on five business days notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple increased the availability of proxy access by limiting the circumstances under which the maximum number of proxy access candidates is reduced.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, Apple no longer reduces the number of proxy access candidates when an incumbent director was nominated through proxy access in the last two years and is subsequently supported by the Board for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders may now re-nominate a proxy access candidate regardless of the level of support received at the annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This change renders moot the amendment requested in point 3 of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has extended the deadline by which nominating shareholders and proxy access candidates must provide certain information to Apple to ten business days from five business days.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has narrowed the scope of a nominating shareholders indemnification obligations to legal and regulatory violations arising out of a nominating shareholders actions or communications with Apple shareholders or out of information provided by a nominating shareholder to Apple.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple has limited the discretion of the Board to unilaterally interpret the proxy access provisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our proxy access framework strikes the right balance between promoting shareholder nomination rights and protecting the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our framework is a reasonable, usable one that reinforces the Boards accountability and provides broad discretion to shareholders to nominate candidates of their choosing, while mitigating the risk of misuse of proxy access, including utilization by shareholders pursuing objectives that are not broadly supported by other shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Implementation of the changes requested by the proposal beyond those Apple has already made would make Apple an outlier among public companies that have adopted proxy access.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beyond mere proxy access, Apples bylaws also keep directors accountable to shareholders by providing for an automatic termination of service of any incumbent director who fails to be elected by an affirmative vote of a majority of the shares represented and voting in an uncontested election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some companies merely require a director to submit a resignation letter
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 60
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: under similar circumstances, and give the board of directors discretion as to whether to accept the resignation  potentially allowing the director to remain on the board indefinitely.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes that our process, which results in automatic termination of the directors term, fosters greater accountability and responsiveness to shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also shown an ongoing commitment to board refreshment and to having highly qualified directors who bring diverse perspectives to the Boards decision-making processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Through the Boards robust director nomination and annual self-evaluation process, two new directors have been added since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to ensuring effective, balanced corporate governance while also continually engaging with shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is evidenced by Apples proactive adoption of proxy access in 2015 and shareholder-favorable enhancements in 2016, and by the other actions Apple has taken to ensure that shareholders are given a voice, many of which are described in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that these objectives are being achieved through Apples current governance processes and that changing our proxy access framework as outlined by the proponent is therefore unnecessary and unwarranted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 7.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Proposal on Executive Compensation Reform
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved: shareholders recommend that Apple Inc. engage multiple outside independent experts or resources rom the general public to reform its executive compensation principles and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: According to Apple Notice of 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, Since 2014, the Compensation Committee has engaged the services of Pay Governance LLC, on matters for which the Compensation Committee is responsible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, any single consulting firm cannot represent the general public, such as independent scholars, think tanks, unions and academic societies, to advise fair, just and ethical compensation principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The failure of our executive compensation principles and practices is clearly shown in the same $1,000,000 salary, the same $20,000,105 stock award and the same $4,000,000 non-equity incentive plan compensation each in 2015 to our five of six named executive officers (p.35).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is use of the Compensation Committee when it could not differentiate the contribution of the tremendously different functions of the CFO, the Retail and Online Stores SVP, the Internet Software and Services SVP, the Hardware Engineering SVP and the Secretary of our company?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Professor Thomas Piketty (Capital in the Twenty- First Century, trans. Arthur Goldhammer. Cambridge: The Belknap Press of Harvard University Press, 2014) stated, there is absolutely no doubt that the increase of inequality in the United States contributed to the nations financial instability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Let me return now to the cause of rising inequality in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The increase was largely the result of an unprecedented increase in wage inequality and in particular the emergence of extremely high remunerations at the summit of the wage hierarchy, particularly among top managers of large firms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because it is objectively difficult to measure individual contributions to a firms output, top managers found it relatively easy to persuade boards and stockholders that they were worth the money, especially since the members of compensation committees were often chosen in a rather incestuous manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the purpose of this proposal, the Board and the Compensation Committee have the flexibility to select multiple independent experts or sources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Statement in Opposition to Proposal No. 8
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 8.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program is designed to attract, motivate, and retain a talented, entrepreneurial, and creative team of executives who will provide leadership for Apples success in dynamic and competitive markets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Internal pay equity among our executive officers does not demonstrate a failure of compensation principles and practices; rather, it is a hallmark of the team-based approach of our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers are expected to operate as a high-performing team, and we believe that generally awarding the same base salary, annual cash incentive, and long-term equity awards to each of our executive officers, other than the CEO, successfully supports this goal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: | 2017 Proxy Statement | 62
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples Compensation Committee is responsible for Apples compensation and incentive plans and programs, approves all compensation for Apples executive officers, and acts as the administrative committee for Apples employee equity plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee consists entirely of independent directors who have various resources and tools at their disposal to assist in the performance of their duties without the addition of multiple outside independent experts or resources from the general public whose priorities and interests may differ from those of Apple or our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of its charter, the Compensation Committee has the right, in its sole discretion, at any time to retain or obtain advice, reports, or opinions from such internal and external counsel, compensation consultants, and other experts and advisors as it deems necessary or appropriate to assist it in the full performance of its functions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For many years, the Compensation Committee has retained an independent compensation consultant, and has engaged the services of Pay Governance since 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Governance works with the Compensation Committee to develop effective executive pay programs based on its knowledge of Apples industry and business needs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Governance provides advice to the Compensation Committee on a range of external market factors, including evolving compensation trends, appropriate peer companies, and market survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pay Governance also provides general observations about our compensation programs and management recommendations regarding the amount and form of compensation for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Compensation Committee conducts a review of Apples executive compensation program and takes into account numerous factors, including the advice of its independent compensation consultant, management recommendations, pay practices and program designs at peer companies, shareholder feedback, and the Compensation Committees own business judgment, which is informed by the significant experience of its members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders also have an opportunity each year to cast an advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers, the results of which the Compensation Committee considers each year when reviewing our executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the alignment of our executive compensation program with the interests of shareholders is reflected by the fact that approximately 95% of votes cast on our say-on-pay proposal at the 2016 annual meeting of shareholders voted to approve the compensation paid to our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes this Proposal No. 8 is unnecessary, not consistent with market practice, and would provide no benefit to Apple or our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee already has extensive knowledge and resources at its disposal to establish appropriate executive compensation principles and practices for Apple that are aligned with the interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 8.

sentences.text: In addition to stock ownership guidelines, Apple maintains other significant governance policies relating to Apple stock held by executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include an anti-hedging policy for all employees and a prohibition against short sales of Apple common stock by executive officers and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Moreover, RSUs granted to executives are subject to the recoupment provisions of Apples standard forms of RSU agreement, which provide that Apple may recover any shares or other amounts obtained from RSUs in the event the executive commits a felony while employed by Apple, or engages in a breach of confidentiality, commits an act of theft, embezzlement or fraud, or materially breaches any agreement with Apple while employed by Apple or at any time thereafter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple believes this Proposal No. 9 is unnecessary and would provide no benefit to Apple or our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples current executive compensation program and governance practices already create a substantial retention incentive and encourage Apples executives to focus on Apples long-term business objectives, stock price performance, and shareholders interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of the reasons above, the Board recommends a vote AGAINST Proposal No. 9.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approval of Proposal No. 9 requires the affirmative vote of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a majority of the shares present or represented by proxy and voting at the Annual Meeting and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a majority of the shares required to constitute a quorum.

sentences.text: Audit and Finance Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee consists of four members: Ron Sugar, who serves as the Chair of the Committee, James Bell, Art Levinson, and Sue Wagner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member is an independent director under NASDAQ, NYSE, and SEC audit committee structure and membership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee has certain duties and powers as described in its written charter adopted by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the charter is available on Apples website at investor.apple.com/corporate-governance.cfm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee assists the Boards oversight and monitoring of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples financial statements and other financial information provided by Apple to its shareholders and others;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apples system of internal con  treasury and finance matters;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: enterprise risk management, privacy, and data security; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the auditing, accounting, and financial reporting process generally
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee does not itself prepare financial statements or perform audits, and its members are not auditors or certifiers of Apples financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee is responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention, and oversight of the work performed by Apples independent registered public accounting firm, Ernst & Young LLP.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its oversight responsibility, the Audit and Finance Committee carefully reviews the policies and procedures for the engagement of the independent registered public accounting firm, including the scope of the audit, audit fees, auditor independence matters, performance of the independent auditors, and the extent to which the independent registered public accounting firm may be retained to perform non-audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Apple maintains an auditor independence policy that, among other things, prohibits Apples independent registered public accounting firm from performing non-financial consulting services, such as information technology consulting and internal audit services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy mandates that the Audit and Finance Committee approve in advance the audit and permissible non-audit services to be performed by the independent registered public accounting firm and the related budget, and that the Audit and Finance Committee be provided with quarterly reporting on actual spending.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy also mandates that Apple may not enter into engagements with Apples independent registered public accounting firm for non-audit services without the express pre-approval of the Audit and Finance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee has reviewed and discussed the audited financial statements for the year ended September 24, 2016 with Apples management and Ernst & Young, Apples independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee has also discussed with Ernst & Young the matters required to be discussed by Auditing Standard No. 1301, Communications with Audit Committees issued by the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit and Finance Committee also has received and reviewed the written disclosures and the letter from Ernst & Young required by applicable requirements of the PCAOB regarding Ernst & Youngs communications with the Audit and Finance Committee concerning independence, and has discussed with Ernst & Young its independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the Audit and Finance Committee recommended to the Board that the financial statements referred to above be included in Apples Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended September 24, 2016 for filing with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires Apples officers and directors, and persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of Apples equity securities, to file reports of securities ownership and changes in such ownership with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Officers, directors, and greater than 10% shareholders also are required by SEC rules to furnish Apple with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based solely upon a review of the copies of such forms furnished to Apple, and on written representations from the reporting persons, Apple believes that all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to Apples directors and officers were timely met during 2016, except that one Form 4 was filed for Chris Kondo on August 5, 2016 with respect to the disposition of 9,829 shares of Apples common stock on August 2, 2016.
